value.title: Import your excel model into Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you spent hours creating an excel model with Power Query and PowerPivot and you or your company has now decided to move to Power BI?  Well, don't worry, you can import your excel models in Power BI and most of it will be imported, included the visuals if you created them using Power View, Yey!

value.title: Power BI Tips & Tricks #07: Change multiple hardcoded path sources at once in Power BI
value.excerpt: If you have opened a power bi file on a different computer that has excel, csv, txt as source files, you probably have seen the error message telling you that Power bI could not find a part of the path.  I am going to show you an easy way to solve this.  Here you can download the pbix file: http://trantor.synology.me:5000/fbsharing/nc9kfXTw

value.title: Power BI vs Excel: When you should use each tool
value.excerpt: Which tool is best? Power BI or Excel?  Well, it depends on what you are trying to do. Both tools have unique strengths and limitations and in this video I will try to show both.  Hopefully after watching this video, you will have a better understanding of both tools and will know when to use which depending

value.title: What is Vertipaq and how does it work? Part 1: Data compression
value.excerpt: What is Vertipaq and how does it work? Part 1: Data compression Vertipaq is the database and engine that runs on top of Power BI and PowerPivot.   When we import data in Power BI, the Vertipaq database will try with a series of algorithms, to compress the data as much as possible and the best way possible

value.excerpt: How do I activate Dark mode in Power BI? Short answer, you cant, but it is in the power bi roadmap (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UFvQ661kK6M). In this video we will talk about when dark mode is planned, issues when embedding power bi reports where dark mode is available and also discuss some additional

value.title: Add Single Apply button to the Filter Pane to apply All Changes at Once in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this vlog, we will talk about how we can optimize the filter pane for Query Reduction by Applying all the filters at once in the Power BI. This is the newly rolled out feature by Microsoft during May 2020 Power BI Desktop Update.  This is a report level setting which we need to enable for each report
